We have the honour to refer to Article 19A of the Dhofar Oil Concession Agreement dated the 24th June, 1937> and to bring it to Your Highness's notice that it is the Company's desire and intention to terminate that Concession six months from the date of this letter of declaration, that is, the 20th December, 1950* 2. The date of expiry of the six months notice will be the 19th June, 1951 and at this date the Concession Agreement shall absolutely determine. 3. We would draw Your Highness's attention to the fact that payments due under the Concession Agreement are paid yearly in arrears on the 8th day of the month of May and that we propose on 8th May, 1951 to pay to Your Highness the amount due for the year ending 8th May, 1951> plus the balance of the period of Notice of Termination which expires on 19th June, 1951 which is at the same rate. 4. We are taking this action with the full knowledge of His Britannic Majesty's Government and His Excellency the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. A copy of this letter has been sent to His Excellency the Political Resident and to H.B.M's Political Agent, Muscat. 5. We shall be pleased if Your Highness will confirm as soon as convenient that the above arrangement is in order and meets with your approval. 6. Should Your Highness however desire to treat the Concession as terminating absolutely on the 8th May, 1951> or even earlier, and would inform us to this effect we would be willing to reduce the notice period accordingly. physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in rough chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file comprises two items of correspondence concerning the termination of the concession held by Petroleum Development (Oman and Dhofar) Limited for oil exploration in Dhofar. The correspondence is between Basil Henry le Riolet Lermitte and the Sultan of Muscat and Oman [Sa‘īd bin Taymūr Āl Bū Sa‘īd].The file also includes a letter from Lermitte to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf (William Rupert Hay) informing that the Sultan had approved the arrangements in which the separate concession for Dhofar was renounced.
